definition: A coastal region in southern Spain along the Mediterranean Sea, known for its beaches, golf courses, and luxury real estate. The name means 'Coast of the Sun' in Spanish.
A prestigious resort city on the Costa del Sol, famous for luxury properties, Puerto Banús marina, and the Golden Mile. One of Spain's most exclusive real estate markets.
An exclusive marina and luxury shopping area in Marbella, known for high-end boutiques, restaurants, and some of the most expensive properties in Spain.
A prestigious stretch of coastline between Marbella city center and Puerto Banús, featuring luxury hotels, exclusive residences, and prime beachfront properties.
Número de Identificación de Extranjero - A tax identification number required for all foreigners conducting financial transactions in Spain, including property purchases.
The Spanish property deed or title deed that proves legal ownership of a property. Essential document in Spanish real estate transactions.
An official property registry document that shows current ownership, mortgages, and any legal charges on a Spanish property.
Impuesto de Transmisiones Patrimoniales - Transfer tax paid when purchasing second-hand properties in Spain, typically 8-10% of the purchase price.
Spanish VAT (Value Added Tax) applied to new property purchases, typically 10% for residential properties and 21% for commercial properties.
Municipal capital gains tax paid when selling a property in Spain, calculated based on the increase in land value during the ownership period.
Spain's central bank that regulates mortgage lending and sets monetary policy. Important for foreign buyers seeking Spanish mortgages.
Official registration with the local town hall (ayuntamiento) that proves Spanish residency. Required for various services and tax benefits.
Certificate of habitability issued by local authorities confirming that a property meets minimum living standards and building regulations.
Official property value set by Spanish authorities for tax purposes. Usually lower than market value and used to calculate property taxes.
Impuesto sobre Bienes Inmuebles - Annual property tax paid to the local municipality, calculated based on the catastral value of the property.
Annual waste collection tax (Tasa de Basura) paid to the local municipality for garbage collection and waste management services.
Monthly or quarterly fees paid by property owners in developments or apartment buildings for maintenance of common areas, security, and shared facilities.
First occupation license certifying that a new build property has been completed according to approved plans and is ready for habitation.
Water supply tax in certain Spanish regions, typically paid annually or semi-annually for water supply infrastructure and services.
Legal document (Poder) allowing someone to act on your behalf in Spanish property transactions. Essential for buyers who cannot be present for completion.
